column3: U-157 (KrvKpt. Wolf Henne). Sunk at 2150hrs on 13 June 1942 in the Gulf of Mexico north of Havana
column7: by depth charges from the US Coast Guard cutter UCGC Thetis.

column3: U-153 (FrgKpt. Wilfried Reichmann). Sunk 6 July 1942 in the Caribbean Sea north-west of Aruba
column6: by depth charges from a US A-20A Havoc aircraft (59th BS USAAF/40-106).

column3: U-166 (Oblt. Hans-Günther Kuhlmann). Sunk on 30 July 1942 in the Gulf of Mexico south-east of New Orleans
column6: by depth charges from the US patrol craft USS PC-566.

column3: U-654 (Oblt. Ludwig Forster). Sunk on 22 August 1942 in the Caribbean Sea north of Colon
column6: by depth charges from a US B-18 Bolo aircraft (45th Bomb Sqn USAAF).

column3: U-94 (Oblt. Otto Ites). Sunk on 28 August 1942 in the Caribbean Sea east of Jamaica
column6: by depth charges from a US Catalina aircraft (VP-92 USN) and ramming by the Canadian corvette HMCS Oakville.

column3: U-162 (FrgKpt. Jürgen Wattenberg). Sunk on 3 September 1942 in the Atlantic north-east of Trinidad
column6: by depth charges from the British destroyers HMS Vimy

column3: U-176 (KrvKpt. Reiner Dierksen). Sunk on 15 May 1943 in the Florida Straits north-east of Havana
column6: by depth charges from the Cuban patrol craft CS 13.

column3: U-759 (Kptlt. Rudolf Friedrich). Sunk on 15 July 1943 in the Caribbean Sea south of Haiti
column6: by depth charges from a US Mariner aircraft (VP-32 USN/P-10).

column3: U-359 (Oblt. (R) Heinz Förster). Sunk on 26 July 1943 in the Caribbean Sea east of Jamaica
column6: by depth charges from a US Mariner aircraft (VP-32 USN/P-12).

column3: U-159 (Oblt. (R) Heinz Beckmann). Sunk on 28 July 1943 in the Caribbean Sea
column7: by depth charges from a US Mariner aircraft (VP-32 USN/P-1).

column3: U-615 (Kptlt. Ralph Kapitzky). Sunk on 7 August 1943 in the Caribbean Sea north-west of Grenada
column6: by depth charges from five US Mariner (VP-204 USN/P-6 & P-8
column8: P-4 & P-11) and a US Ventura aircraft (VB-130 USN/B-5).

column3: U-84 (Kptlt. Horst Uphoff). Sunk on 7 August 1943 in the North Atlantic south-west of Bermuda
column6: by a Fido homing torpedo from a US Liberator aircraft (VB-105 USN/B-4).
